alert.note: Alert for Creek; McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 12:36AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Creek, northwestern McIntosh, Okmulgee, southeastern Tulsa and eastern Okfuskee Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1236 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Okfuskee to 4 miles northwest of Pharoah to 4 miles northeast of Wetumka. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Broken Arrow... Okmulgee... Bixby... Okfuskee... Henryetta... Morris... Beggs... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Stidham... Preston... Pharoah... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Liberty... Hitchita... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 224 and 256. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
